entry.name: accordion
entry.title: Accordion Widget
entry.desc: Convert a pair of headers and content panels into an accordion.

longdesc.p: The markup of your accordion container needs pairs of headers and content panels:

pre.code:
First header

First content panel

Second header

Second content panel

longdesc.p: Accordions support arbitrary markup, but each content panel must always be the next sibling after its associated header. See the header option for information on how to use custom markup structures.
The panels can be activated programmatically by setting the active option.
When focus is on a header, the following key commands are available:

ul.li: UP/LEFT - Move focus to the previous header. If on first header, moves focus to last header.
DOWN/RIGHT - Move focus to the next header. If on last header, moves focus to first header.
HOME - Move focus to the first header.
END - Move focus to the last header.
SPACE/ENTER - Activate panel associated with focused header.

longdesc.p: When focus is in a panel:

ul.li: CTRL+UP: Move focus to associated header.
Effects Core (optional; for use with the animate option)

type.name: Boolean
type.desc: Setting active to false will collapse all panels. This requires the collapsible option to be true.

type.name: Integer
type.desc: The zero-based index of the panel that is active (open). A negative value selects panels going backward from the last panel.

option.name: animate
option.desc: If and how to animate changing panels.

type.name: Boolean
type.desc: A value of false will disable animations.

type.name: Number
type.desc: Duration in milliseconds with default easing.

type.name: String
type.desc: Name of easing to use with default duration.

type.name: Object
type.desc:
Animation settings with easing and duration properties.
Can also contain a down property with any of the above options.
"Down" animations occur when the panel being activated has a lower index than the currently active panel.

option.name: collapsible
option.desc: Whether all the sections can be closed at once. Allows collapsing the active section.

option.name: event
option.desc: The event that accordion headers will react to in order to activate the associated panel. Multiple events can be specificed, separated by a space.

desc.p: Selector for the header element, applied via .find() on the main accordion element. Content panels must be the sibling immedately after their associated headers.
Controls the height of the accordion and each panel. Possible values:

ul.li: "auto": All panels will be set to the height of the tallest panel.
"fill": Expand to the available height based on the accordion's parent height.
"content": Each panel will be only as tall as its content.

desc.p: Icons to use for headers, matching an icon defined by the jQuery UI CSS Framework. Set to false to have no icons displayed.

event.name: activate
event.desc: Triggered after a panel has been activated (after animation completes). If the accordion was previously collapsed, ui.oldHeader and ui.oldPanel will be empty jQuery objects. If the accordion is collapsing, ui.newHeader and ui.newPanel will be empty jQuery objects.

property.name: newHeader
property.desc: The header that was just activated.

property.name: oldHeader
property.desc: The header that was just deactivated.

property.name: newPanel
property.desc: The panel that was just activated.

property.name: oldPanel
property.desc: The panel that was just deactivated.

event.name: beforeActivate
event.desc: Triggered directly before a panel is activated. Can be canceled to prevent the panel from activating. If the accordion is currently collapsed, ui.oldHeader and ui.oldPanel will be empty jQuery objects. If the accordion is collapsing, ui.newHeader and ui.newPanel will be empty jQuery objects.

property.name: newHeader
property.desc: The header that is about to be activated.

property.name: oldHeader
property.desc: The header that is about to be deactivated.

property.name: newPanel
property.desc: The panel that is about to be activated.

property.name: oldPanel
property.desc: The panel that is about to be deactivated.

event.name: create
event.desc: Triggered when the accordion is created. If the accordion is collapsed, ui.header and ui.panel will be empty jQuery objects.

method.name: refresh
method.desc: Recompute the height of the accordion panels. Results depend on the content and the heightStyle option.
